mechanism: Transfer learning with structured graph representations enables few-shot adaptation across related domains by identifying shared interaction principles from well-studied systems and rapidly adapting to new contexts with minimal training data.

Systems with delayed feedback combined with censored observations face fundamental learning limitations compared to systems with immediate uncensored feedback, creating a sharp performance separation even with identical optimization algorithms.

Sign-based gradient transformation equalizes learning rates across hierarchical frequency components by removing magnitude dependence, eliminating bottlenecks from low-frequency modes and enabling exponentially faster convergence.

Surrogate-assisted proposal generation with dynamic correction bounds enables efficient exploration when exact evaluations are expensive: surrogate provides cheap proposals, dynamic offset enforcement maintains correctness.

Competing processes of local energy injection and spatial energy redistribution create sharp selectivity and high amplification when balanced: injection provides gain, redistribution creates filtering through dissipative wave propagation.

Controllability-efficiency tradeoff in coupled resource management: independent regulation of multiple coupled resources requires balanced abundances to prevent cross-interference, but balanced states incur higher thermodynamic costs through increased entropy production.

Parallel networks with distinct failure modes enable large reversible deformations: brittle bond network governs initial stiffness and yield point, entropic elastic network enables large deformations post-yield; reorganization and rebonding during recovery locks new equilibrium with increased stiffness.

Population-level inference with uncertainty-aware fusion decouples global dynamics from individual variability: clustering behaviorally similar entities, encoding mechanistic priors, and fusing uncertain predictions at cluster level enables scalable simulation.

Hybrid models combining feature detection and nonlinear estimation adapt to complex dynamics across varying operating conditions by decomposing the task: one component identifies salient patterns, another estimates outputs using detected features.

Dynamic resource allocation adapts commitment timing to local uncertainty: allocating more processing to uncertain regions while quickly committing to certain regions avoids premature decisions and improves both quality and efficiency.

Feed-forward geometric transformation with multi-view projection creates bidirectional improvement between teacher and student: transforming teacher outputs to alternative viewpoints provides richer supervision, enabling student to improve teacher's consistency.

Multi-scale adaptation combining global domain knowledge and instance-specific adjustments prevents error accumulation in continual learning: global prompts capture broad patterns for anti-forgetting, instance prompts adapt dynamically to local variations.

Iterative denoising of sparse representations conditioned on coarse predictions refines boundaries in low-data regimes: sparse encoding reduces sample complexity, conditioning provides structural constraints, iteration improves precision.

Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.

Self-amplifying coupling to periodic components of stochastic forcing drives phase transition from unstructured to structured behavior: weak periodic signals in noise become amplified through positive feedback, spontaneously synchronizing system components.

External behavioral anchors induce strategic compliance and cognitive offloading without genuine norm internalization: agents mimic anchor behavior locally to reduce cognitive load, but revert to self-interested behavior when anchors absent or unobservable.

Constraining process trajectories to fixed subgraph of possibility space enables efficient verification without full enumeration: defining acceptable path subgraph and verifying containment cheaper than exploring all possibilities.

Sequential optimization respecting variable structure outperforms concurrent optimization ignoring structure: grouping structurally similar variables and optimizing in stages leverages domain knowledge to guide search more effectively.

Evolutionary optimization with hardware-in-the-loop feedback automates expert-driven resource mapping by directly evaluating candidate mappings on target hardware, learning effective heuristics without manual tuning.

Landscape-similarity proxies decouple algorithm discovery from expensive target evaluation: generating cheap proxy problems matching target's landscape characteristics enables extensive algorithm search before costly validation.

Augmented state space with corrective dynamics extends equilibrium-based learning to non-conservative systems: adding auxiliary variables and non-reciprocal correction terms to learning dynamics recovers exact gradients despite broken energy conservation.

Contrastive concept learning guides search by amplifying useful combinations and suppressing misleading ones: building hierarchical concept representation, learning which concepts correlate with success vs failure, and biasing exploration accordingly.

Online recurrent learning continuously adapts pretrained policies to environmental drift and task changes: biologically-plausible real-time weight updates enable deployed systems to maintain performance under non-stationary conditions.

Optimal resource extraction from networked populations balances local growth rates and network-mediated redistribution: harvest intensity should scale with intrinsic productivity and effective incoming flow from connected patches.

Behavioral heterogeneity with homophily creates resurgence dynamics near critical thresholds: diverse risk responses combined with preferential interaction among similar types produces initial decline followed by secondary surge as low-risk subpopulation becomes infected.

Conditioning on rare large events (quenched dynamics) versus averaging over event realizations (annealed dynamics) yields qualitatively different limiting processes: quenched limits preserve event-specific structure, annealed limits smooth over variability.

Unified adaptive schemes eliminate manual parameter tuning while maintaining accuracy across diverse problem instances: automatic error-driven refinement of resolution and interaction distances adapts to local geometric complexity.

Phase transition between constrained (glass-like) and unconstrained (liquid-like) regimes identifies minimal informative feature sets: critical feature count where order-parameter distributions shift from bimodal to unimodal marks saturation of downstream task performance.

Scaling behavior depends jointly on model capacity, training data volume, and input representation structure: different representations yield different scaling exponents, making representation choice as critical as model size for performance.

Controlled transport relative to informed reference process yields low-action paths through high-likelihood regions: defining generation as deviation from biologically-informed baseline keeps intermediate states plausible throughout trajectory.

Environmental state dominates progression dynamics over intrinsic mutation rates in spatially structured systems: supportive environments amplify weak growth signals into invasive spread, while inhibitory environments suppress even high-mutation populations.

Non-Hermitian parameter tuning drives continuous transition between energy-localized and momentum-localized topological phases: varying loss and coupling enables PT-symmetry breaking that smoothly transforms gap structure from spatial to temporal character.

Coexisting dynamical regimes generate competing mode families with non-uniform spectral gaps and persistent modal competition: regular regions support long-lived coherent modes, chaotic regions produce rapid mixing, and coupling between regions creates intermediate tunneling modes.

Inverting traditional compute-storage roles decouples system scale from accelerator capacity constraints: treating high-capacity persistent storage as authoritative state and fast accelerators as transient compute engines enables larger models than accelerator memory allows.

Non-local quantum correlations enable superior coordination in distributed systems with convex reward functions: instantaneous shared randomness from entanglement avoids communication latency costs when longer uninterrupted processing yields superlinear rewards.

Incremental residual representations with lazy evaluation and adaptive resource allocation improve efficiency-accuracy tradeoffs: computing only changed components, deferring updates until needed, and dynamically allocating budget reduce redundant computation.
